thread.title: 10 exciting things to do on a day out in Oxfordshire
thread.title_full: 10 exciting things to do on a day out in Oxfordshire

title: 10 exciting things to do on a day out in Oxfordshire
text: 10 exciting things to do on a day out in Oxfordshire 10 exciting things to do on a day out in Oxfordshire HERE'S 10 of the most exciting things to do in Oxfordshire: PUBLISHED: 00:00, Mon, Sep 21, 2015 | UPDATED: 14:34, Mon, Sep 21, 2015 GETTY - POSED A guided tour of the Wychwood Brewery in Witney takes visitors through the brewing process 1. Go on a brewery tour at to discover how the legendary Wychwood and Brakspear beers are created. A guided tour of the Wychwood Brewery in Witney takes visitors through the brewing process from raw ingredients all the way to the finished product. Afterwards, you can sample the flagship Legendary Hobgoblin. www.wychwood.co.uk/#/tours//hobgoblin/tours 2. Discover the largest private collection of Formula 1 cars in the world, charting over 30 years of racing history of the Williams F1 team. Public tours are operated most months at Williams F1 Collection at Grove in Wantage and include seeing unique video footage and a visit to the Technology and Trophy rooms. www.williamsf1.com/conference-centre/collection-and-tours/public-tours 3. Solve a mystery crime. Ex(c)iting Game is a fun programme for the entire family: You have 60 minutes to solve the mystery and escape from a room that has been set up like a crime scene. Each detail and object in the room is part of the game, so make sure to not overlook anything - and don't fall for the hidden traps! You'll find it in Oxford on the A420. www.excitinggame.co.uk 4. Drive a steam train. At Chinnor & Princes Risborough Railway visitors don't just have the chance to go on a train journey but can also book a 'Driver Experience' with the steam or heritage diesel locomotives in Chinnor and make your childhood dreams come true! www.chinnorrailway.co.uk Go on a brewery tour at to discover how the legendary Wychwood and Brakspear beers are created 5. See rowing boats used in the Olympics at the River & Rowing Museum in Henley. You'll find the museum in a beautiful setting on the banks of the river. Discover all about the history of rowing, including Olympic rowing, and the River Thames. There are lots of beautiful old boats to see, including a rowing boat from the Olympic Games in Sydney and old wooden skiffs. www.rrm.co.uk 6. Go on a road trip by bike or potter along the towpath past the barges. Bainton Bikes hire anything from road to mountain bikes - and take guided tours, or offer self-guided expeditions around Oxford and Oxfordshire. It's a great way to discover this the beautiful area. Choose your own difficulty level and let the Bainton Bikes team work out a route to suit you. www.baintonbikes.com 7. Hear the inside story on top TV series Inspector Morse as you go on a location tour, walking around the Oxford streets where the detective series was filmed. The tour runs every Monday, Friday and Saturday (Saturday only in winter) and visits the sites of some of the best-known cases with lots of lively anecdotes on the way. www.visitoxfordandoxfordshire.com/eshop/thedms.aspx?dms=72&shop=8‚àè=8472 Related articles Visit Greenwich Village one of the most interesting places in New... 8. Take to the river. Salter's Steamers offer everything from leisurely river cruises, to hiring rowing, motor or diesel boats and punts. The company has been around since 1858 and knows the river like no one else. Your'll find them at Folly Bridge or Donnington Bridge in Oxford. www.salterssteamers.co.uk 9. Discover Oxford's dark secrets and lift the lid on this ancient city when you sign up for the spine-tingling Bill Spectre's Ghost Trail. The award-winning tour is said to be among the world's Top 10 Ghost Tours. www.ghosttrail.org 10. Have a laugh at a Saturday night session at Oxford's Glee Club. Some of the best comedians in the country can be found here as the short distance from London often brings guests from the UK's comedy hotspot without the London Price-tag. www.glee.co.uk/oxford/
